snippet: The Italian lender also plans to sell some businesses as it seeks to raise $5.4 billion of fresh capital to shore up its balance sheet....
abstract: Marco Morelli, chief executive of Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena, unveils reorganization of beleaguered Italian bank that includes job cuts, branch closings and sale of assets, and plans to tap investors for another 5 billion euros or about $5.4 billion; bank has recently lost billions of euros and was worst performer in stress tests conducted in 2016 by European Banking Authority.
lead_paragraph: The Italian lender also plans to sell some businesses as it seeks to raise $5.4 billion of fresh capital to shore up its balance sheet.

headline.main: Monte dei Paschi to Cut Jobs and Close Branches in Turnaround Bid
headline.print_headline: Troubled Italian Bank Unveils Recovery Plan
